title: Experience Channel
description: There are multiple experience channels, each with different constraints on how content is delivered and how customer interaction can be observed and data collected. Within a channel, experiences can be delivered to specific locations. The locations and types of locations that exist in a channel differ from channel to channel.

_id.description: The ID uniquely identifies the channel. Each specific experience channel defines a constant `@id`.

mode.description: How experiences are delivered in this channel.

_type.description: The `@type` property is used to provide a rough classification of channels with similar properties.

mediaType.description: Describes whether the media type is paid,owned or earned.

mediaAction.description: The `mediaAction` property is used to provide a type of experiance event media action .

contentTypes.description: The content types that this channel can deliver.

items.description: The `@type` of an XDM-defined content type that is supported by this channel.

metricTypes.description: The metrics that can be collected in this channel.

items.description: The `@type` of an XDM-defined metric that is supported by this channel.

locationTypes.description: The types of locations (virtual places) that this channel consists of and can deliver content to.

items.description: The `@type` of an XDM-defined location (virtual place) that this channel can contain.
